## Protected Static Functions

### allocateWithKey() {#ad02f1e31d20dcd30fca53cf59db4e00d}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename AllocatorTy&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void &#42; llvm::StringMapEntryBase::allocateWithKey (size&#95;t EntrySize, size&#95;t EntryAlign, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Key, AllocatorTy &amp; Allocator)</>}
  labels = {["protected", "static"]}>
Helper to tail-allocate <code>Key</code>.

It&#39;d be nice to generalize this so it could be reused elsewhere, maybe even taking an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">llvm::function&#95;ref</a> to type-erase the allocator and put it in a source file.
